q: Speaking of corporate shake-ups, Mountain View Internet juggernaut Google revealed that co-founder Larry Page will become CEO effective April 4. Current CEO Eric Schmidt will be executive chairman, and co-founder Sergey Brin will remain co-founder, devoting his time and energy to strategic projects, Eric Schmidt wrote in a blog post. And it was a somewhat awkward moment in the meeting, he said. The plot also targeted President Bush 's two daughters, Donald Rumsfeld said, and President Bush urged him to take it seriously because the administration had killed Saddam Hussein 's sons.

political operatives say he must do if he hopes to be re-elected. "The jury is still out on which way the Bill Clinton is going to go," said Greg Mueller , a Republican political strategist. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. "For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center," said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri. "This country is not ready for a pure progressive.

Windows 8 will support system-on-a-chip architectures using ARM processors. Unlike the x86 architecture that today's Windows laptops and desktops work with, ARM-based chips tend to run such low-power devices as tablets and smartphones. Steve Ballmer said, This announcement is really all about enabling a new class of hardware, and new silicon partners for Windows, to bring the widest possible range of form factors to the market.
